2.2.13-002.asw_1: - use the time left on the meter without inserting more money
2.2.13-002.asw_2: - not use the time left on the meter
2.2.13-002.asw_3: - only use the time left on the meter when using a parking disc
2.2.13-002.info: Even if another person has paid, the use of the remaining parking time on a parking meter is permitted.
2.2.13-002.text: The time on a parking meter has not yet run out. What do you do?

2.2.13-003.info: Stopping and parking are permitted only for the time indicated on the additional plate, provided that the vehicle has a parking disc that is clearly legible from the outside, and the pointer of the disc is set to the line of half an hour following the time of stopping. The time indicated on the parking disc may be rounded up to the half hour from the time that the vehicle has parked.
2.2.13-003.text: At 10.40, you enter an area where parking is allowed for 2 hours when using a parking disc. What time must you set on the parking disc?

2.2.13-004.asw_1: Place a valid parking ticket in your vehicle so it is easy to read from outside
2.2.13-004.asw_2: Do not exceed the parking time indicated on the parking ticket
2.2.13-004.asw_3: A parking ticket is never needed when using a parking disc
2.2.13-004.info: Parking meters may only be operated while the clock is running, and parking ticket machines may only operate with a parking ticket, which must be clearly legible from the outside on or in the vehicle, for the duration of the permitted parking time. Exceeding the permitted parking time is not permitted. In this case, a new parking ticket must be issued.
2.2.13-004.text: You want to park in a car park where there is a parking-ticket machine. What must you remember?

2.2.13-101.asw_1: To allow people to get in and out of the vehicle
2.2.13-101.asw_2: To load and unload the vehicle
2.2.13-101.info: Equipment and devices for monitoring parking time need not be operated when entering or leaving the vehicle or for loading or unloading. Such actions usually require only a short stopping time, so there is no need to pay.
2.2.13-101.text: When may you remain parked at a parking meter without activating it?

2.2.14-102.asw_1: Before opening the door, look out for traffic behind
2.2.14-102.asw_2: Secure the vehicle against rolling away
2.2.14-102.asw_3: Secure the vehicle against unauthorized use
2.2.14-102.info: Anyone getting in or out of the vehicle must behave in such a way that there is no danger to other motorists. This makes it necessary to first ascertain and then get out. Anyone driving a vehicle must take the necessary measures to avoid accidents or traffic disruptions when leaving the vehicle. Motor vehicles must also be secured against unauthorised use. Therefore, it may be necessary to apply the parking brake or handbrake on slopes. The vehicle must also be locked.
2.2.14-102.text: What must you do when leaving your car?

2.2.14-104.asw_1: Let passengers get into the car, if possible, from the pavement
2.2.14-104.asw_2: Open the doors on the roadway side only when traffic permits
2.2.14-104.asw_3: The doors on the right-hand side can always be opened without danger
2.2.14-104.info: Anyone getting in or out of the vehicle must behave in such a way that there is no danger to other motorists. This also includes the people who want to get into or out of the vehicle.
2.2.14-104.text: Your car is standing on the edge of the roadway. What should you do when getting into the car?

2.2.14-105.asw_1: Let the children in or out, if possible, on the pavement side
2.2.14-105.asw_2: Let the children in or out on the roadway side only under supervision
2.2.14-105.asw_3: Children are not allowed to get in or out of a car on public roads
2.2.14-105.info: Anyone getting in or out of the vehicle must behave in such a way that there is no danger to other motorists. This also includes the people who want to get into or out of the vehicle. Increased caution is required, especially for children.
2.2.14-105.text: What is important when children are getting in and out of a car?

2.2.15-105.asw_pretext: The steering of the broken down car
2.2.15-105.info: Power steering is not supported without a running motor. As a result, steering is sluggish and stiffer.
2.2.15-105.text: A car with power steering has broken down with engine damage and must be towed away. What is correct?

2.2.15-107.asw_1: Immediately switch on the hazard warning lights
2.2.15-107.asw_2: Place a warning triangle at a sufficient distance
2.2.15-107.info: The hazard warning lights must be switched on immediately. Thereafter, at least one conspicuous warning sign should be placed in a clearly visible location at a sufficient distance. In the case of fast traffic, it should be placed at a distance of approximately 100 metres.
2.2.15-107.text: At night, how must you secure a vehicle which has broken down at a place where it constitutes a danger to other traffic?

2.2.15-109.asw_1: The distance between the vehicles must not exceed 5 m
2.2.15-109.asw_3: Motorcycles may only be towed with a fixed connection
2.2.15-109.info: When towing, the distance between the two vehicles shall not exceed 5 m. It is necessary to mark the towing aid (e.g., with a red flag).
2.2.15-109.text: What must you remember when towing?

2.2.16-001.info: Outside of built-up areas, overtaking may be indicated by short sound or light signals. Flashing headlights acts as such a beacon. When flashing with high beam, oncoming motorists must not be dazzled.
2.2.16-001.text: Where is it permitted to flash headlights to indicate your intention to overtake?

2.2.17-001.info: If the rear fog lamps are switched on, they must be indicated to the driver by an amber indicator light, which must be clearly visible in the driver’s field of vision.This is a requirement that applies to manufacturers. Every registered vehicle is equipped with this feature.
2.2.17-001.text: How can you tell whether the rear fog lamp is switched on?

2.2.17-005.info: If fog, snowfall or rain considerably obstructs visibility, you should drive with low beam during the day. Fog headlamps may only be switched on in such weather conditions.
2.2.17-005.text: Visibility is considerably reduced. When are you allowed to switch on fog headlamps?

2.2.17-008.info: Lights must be dimmed in a timely manner if a vehicle is approaching or driving a short distance ahead. Other motorists must not be dazzled.
2.2.17-008.text: You are driving at night on an unlit road. There is a motor vehicle travelling a short distance in front of you. Which lights must you have on?

2.2.17-101.info: If fog, snowfall or rain considerably obstructs visibility, you should drive with low beam during the day. Fog headlamps may only be switched on in such weather conditions.
2.2.17-101.text: When are you allowed to use fog headlamps also during the day?

2.2.17-102.asw_1: When fog reduces visibility to less than 50 m
2.2.17-102.asw_2: When fog reduces visibility to 100 m
2.2.17-102.asw_3: When visibility is reduced by heavy rain
2.2.17-102.info: Rear fog lamps may only be used when the visibility due to fog is less than 50 m. Otherwise they may dazzle other motorists because of their brightness.
2.2.17-102.text: When are you allowed to switch on rear fog lamps?

2.2.17-103.asw_3: On the hard shoulder of autobahns
2.2.17-103.info: Vehicles stopping outside built-up areas should be lit with their own light source. Within built-up areas, it is sufficient to mark only the side of the vehicle facing the road with parking lamps or other approved means. This ensures that other motorists recognize parked vehicles as obstacles.
2.2.17-103.text: Where is it sufficient to use your parking lights while your car is parked on an unlit roadway?

2.2.17-109.info: At dusk, in the dark or when visibility otherwise requires, the prescribed lighting equipment must be used. This can mean having to drive with dipped headlights during the day.
2.2.17-109.text: When must you use dipped headlights also during the day?

2.2.17-111.asw_1: When the vehicle is parked on the hard shoulder outside built-up areas
2.2.17-111.asw_2: When driving on roads with adequate continuous lighting
2.2.17-111.info: Vehicles stopping outside built-up areas shall be lit with their own light sources. Within built-up areas, it is sufficient to mark only the side of the vehicle facing the road with parking lamps or other approved means. This ensures that other motorists recognize parked vehicles as obstacles.
2.2.17-111.text: During twilight or the hours of darkness, when must you have your side lights switched on as a minimum requirement?

2.2.18-003.info: Drivers of passenger cars and other motor vehicles with a gross vehicle weight of up to 3.5 t are advised not to drive faster than 130 km/h on motorways (recommended speed), even in favourable road, traffic, visibility and weather conditions.
2.2.18-003.text: What is the recommended speed that applies to cars and motorcycles on autobahns?

2.2.18-006.asw_1: Keep an adequate distance behind the vehicle in front
2.2.18-006.asw_2: Allow the vehicle in front to overtake
2.2.18-006.asw_3: Close up to the vehicle in front, sound your horn and flash your lights
2.2.18-006.info: As a rule, the distance to a vehicle in front must be such that it can be held even in the event of sudden braking by the driver in front. This may make it necessary to adjust your own speed. Other motorists should not be forced to stop their overtaking manoeuvre. Instead, they have to be allowed to overtake.
2.2.18-006.text: You are driving in the left of two lanes and approaching a vehicle that has just started to overtake. What do you do?

2.2.18-007.asw_1: As long as is necessary to overtake other vehicles
2.2.18-007.asw_2: As long as you are driving behind a vehicle which is overtaking in the left-hand lane
2.2.18-007.asw_3: All the time, provided no other vehicle wants to overtake you
2.2.18-007.info: At low traffic densities, the right-hand driving requirement applies. Driving on the left lane is permitted in order to overtake other motorists or to follow overtaken vehicles.
2.2.18-007.text: You are driving on the autobahn in light traffic. How long are you allowed to stay in the left-hand lane?

2.2.18-009.asw_2: Join the clearway only at crossroads and junctions
2.2.18-009.asw_3: In darkness, you may drive faster than the range of visibility allowed by dipped headlights
2.2.18-009.info: Entering motorways is only permitted at intersections or junctions. Turning on motorways is prohibited.
2.2.18-009.text: What applies on clearways for motor vehicles only?

2.2.18-011.asw_1: Between the left-hand and the middle lanes
2.2.18-011.asw_2: Between the middle and right-hand lanes
2.2.18-011.info: If the traffic on the autobahn is congested with at least two lanes for one direction, vehicles must form a free lane in the middle of the directional lane for the passage of police and auxiliary vehicles. In the case of lanes with three lanes for one direction, this would be between the left and the middle lane. This is crucial for rescuers to get to the scene quickly.
2.2.18-011.text: A traffic jam has formed on a three-lane autobahn. Where must the channel for emergency vehicles be formed?

2.2.18-101.asw_1: You must leave the autobahn at the next exit
2.2.18-101.asw_2: During towing, both vehicles must have their hazard warning lights switched on
2.2.18-101.asw_3: You may continue along the autobahn to the exit nearest a suitable garage
2.2.18-101.info: When towing a vehicle that has stopped on the motorway, leave the motorway at the next exit. This is imperative, even if it would be helpful to take a later exit with regard to the destination. While being towed, both vehicles must have their hazard warning lights switched on. This measure helps other motorists recognise the two vehicles as early as possible.
2.2.18-101.text: Your vehicle has broken down on the autobahn. What must you remember when having it towed away?

2.2.18-102.asw_1: No stopping on the roadway and hard shoulder
2.2.18-102.asw_3: In darkness, under no circumstances drive faster than the range of visibility allowed by dipped headlights
2.2.18-102.info: Turning and reversing are forbidden on the motorway. Likewise stopping – even on the hard shoulder – is also forbidden.

2.2.21-102.asw_2: On the floor of the truck
2.2.21-102.asw_3: On the floor of the trailer
2.2.21-102.info: Apart from a few exceptions, e.g., on construction sites, it is forbidden to take people on the loading area. Safe transport of passengers is only guaranteed in the cab of the truck.
2.2.21-102.text: You are driving a truck with a trailer and wish to give someone a lift as a favour. Where are you allowed to carry such a passenger?

2.2.21-103.asw_1: That the passengers can put on the existing safety belts
2.2.21-103.asw_2: That you have an adequate view to the rear
2.2.21-103.asw_3: That no objects (e.g. first-aid kit, road atlas, camera) are lying loose on the rear parcel shelf
2.2.21-103.info: Before starting a journey, it must be ensured that safety is not impaired in any way. The view must not be restricted. Objects that can injure the occupants in the event of a collision must be removed or stowed safely before driving. The driver is responsible for the passengers and must ensure that they can fasten their seatbelts.
2.2.21-103.text: What must you ensure before setting off on a journey in your car?

2.2.21-104.asw_1: In an approved child restraint with test mark
2.2.21-104.asw_2: On the lap of an adult
2.2.21-104.asw_3: In a baby carrycot on one of the back seats
2.2.21-104.info: Children under the age of 12 who are smaller than 150 cm may ride in motor vehicles on seats for which safety belts are prescribed only if child restraints are used. Without the use of such systems – even if the child is sitting being held on the lap of an adult – adequate safety cannot be guaranteed.
2.2.21-104.text: How are you allowed to transport a small child in your car?

2.2.21-105.asw_1: In a suitable and approved child seat with test mark
2.2.21-105.asw_2: In a back seat with standard three-point safety belt
2.2.21-105.asw_3: On a back seat with waist belt fastened
2.2.21-105.info: Children under the age of 12 who are smaller than 150 cm may ride in motor vehicles on seats for which safety belts are prescribed only if child restraints are used. Thus, in light of the age of the child, there is no way around the use of an approved restraint system.
2.2.21-105.text: How are you allowed to transport a five-year-old child in your car?

2.2.21-107.asw_1: The child seat must be appropriate for the height and weight of the child
2.2.21-107.asw_2: The child seat must be capable of attachment to the seat of the vehicle for which it is intended
2.2.21-107.asw_3: Nothing apart from the test mark
2.2.21-107.info: Restraint devices must be suitable for the child in question, i.e., taking size and weight into account. Child seats may only be used in car models certified by the manufacturer.
2.2.21-107.text: What should be borne in mind when using an approved child seat with test mark?

2.2.21-108.asw_1: Because you cannot adequately protect yourself in case of an impact at a speed of about 20 km/h
2.2.21-108.asw_2: Because in case of an accident you can be projected out of the vehicle
2.2.21-108.asw_3: Because of the low speed there is no danger in urban traffic
2.2.21-108.info: There are many dangers involved in not wearing a seat belt – both in the front and rear car seats. Even at low speeds there is a risk of serious injury. People who are not strapped in are at risk of being thrown out of the vehicle due to the enormous forces that can be exerted in a collision.
2.2.21-108.text: Why is it dangerous not to wear safety belts?

2.2.21-111.info: Without a seat belt on, fatal injuries can occur at an impact speed of 30 km/h or more.
2.2.21-111.text: At which impact speed must you reckon with serious or deadly injuries when no safety belt is worn?

2.2.21-112.info: Regardless of which seats are secured with airbags, safety belts must be worn on each seat.
2.2.21-112.text: A car is equipped with two front air bags. On which seats must safety belts be worn?

2.2.21-114.asw_1: The children must be secured with the prescribed child restraints
2.2.21-114.asw_2: Child restraints need not be used within built-up areas
2.2.21-114.asw_3: It is sufficient to secure the children with the existing safety belts
2.2.21-114.info: Children under the age of 12 who are smaller than 150 cm may ride in motor vehicles on seats for which safety belts are prescribed only if child restraints are used. If there are not enough restraint devices, several trips are necessary.
2.2.21-114.text: You wish to take several small children home after a children's birthday party. What must you observe when using your car?

2.2.21-117.asw_1: Adjust them to head height according to the operating manual
2.2.21-117.asw_2: They are optimally adjusted by the factory
2.2.21-117.asw_3: For the rear seats they replace the safety belts
2.2.21-117.info: The individual height of each occupant makes it necessary to adjust headrests accordingly.
2.2.21-117.text: What is important to consider about headrests?

2.2.21-118.asw_2: Take the vehicle off the road immediately
2.2.21-118.asw_3: Nothing because it is an indication for the garage workshop
2.2.21-118.info: The airbag indicator light indicates a technical fault – the airbag may no longer be functional. A garage workshop should be visited in order for the proper repairs to be made.
2.2.21-118.text: While you are driving, the airbag control light stays on constantly. What must you do?

2.2.22-103.asw_1: The vehicle inclines more on bends
2.2.22-103.asw_2: The vehicle's susceptibility to side wind is greater
2.2.22-103.asw_3: The vehicle's roadhandling is improved on account of the higher centre of gravity
2.2.22-103.info: The transport of loads on the roof increases the centre of gravity of the vehicle, which results in a stronger inclination in bends, among other things. At the same time, the surface is increased, making the vehicle more susceptible to side winds.
2.2.22-103.text: What must you reckon with when transporting luggage on the roof of your car?

2.2.22-104.asw_1: Safely attach holding device and bicycles
2.2.22-104.info: The use of bicycles on the roof requires the use of a suitable holding device for secure attachment. Regular inspections are necessary to ensure safe transport even over long distances. Avoid high speeds.
2.2.22-104.text: What must you do when transporting bicycles on the roof of your car?

2.2.22-105.asw_1: Whether, according to the manufacturer's instructions, the system is adequate for the vehicle
2.2.22-105.asw_2: Whether system and bicycles are fixed safely
2.2.22-105.asw_3: Whether lighting equipment or number plate are covered
2.2.22-105.info: The use of a rear carrier is only permitted if the vehicle is suitable for it. Check that the rear carrier does not cover the lights or the registration plate. Covering is not permitted, but can be solved by appropriate extensions (e.g., light bars). Also check that both the rear carrier and the bicycles are securely fastened.
2.2.22-105.text: What must you check when transporting bicycles on a rear-mounted support system?

2.2.22-108.asw_1: By a white light to the front
2.2.22-108.asw_2: By a red light to the back
2.2.22-108.asw_3: By switching on the hazard warning lights
2.2.22-108.info: If the load protrudes laterally more than 40 cm beyond the vehicle lights or, in the case of a motor vehicle, beyond the outer edge of the light-emitting surfaces of the front or rear position lamps, the load should be marked in darkness or poor visibility at a maximum of 40 cm from its edge and at a maximum of 1,50 m above the road. It should be marked by a white lamp in the front and by a red lamp at the back.
2.2.22-108.text: How must a load be marked in darkness or bad visibility when it extends laterally more than 40 cm beyond the side lights of the vehicle?

2.2.22-109.info: The securing device must not be placed higher than 1.50 m above the road surface. A higher installation may deceive subsequent traffic and suggest a further distance, although this is not the case.
2.2.22-109.text: What is the maximum height allowed above the roadway for a red light marking a load extending to the back?

2.2.22-111.info: In the case of a load up to a height of 2.50 m on top of the towing vehicle, the trailer must not project forward over the vehicle. In addition, in the case of a load of up to 50 cm above the towing vehicle, the load projection may project up to 50 cm beyond the vehicle.
2.2.22-111.text: Up to what height is a load not allowed to project over the front of the vehicle?

2.2.22-113.asw_1: Continue your trip after the lashing strap has been replaced
2.2.22-113.asw_2: Continue your trip when the load is secured by other sufficient securing means
2.2.22-113.asw_3: Continue your trip because a slipping load will be caught by the side panels
2.2.22-113.info: Anyone driving a vehicle must also ensure that the vehicle, the trailer, the combination, the load and the occupants are in accordance with the regulations and that the road safety of the vehicle is not adversely affected by the load or occupants. This makes it necessary to replace the torn lashing strap with another lashing strap or other securing device and only then continue the journey.
2.2.22-113.text: During a break you find out that one of the lashing straps has torn. What do you do?

2.2.22-114.asw_1: They apply to all small transporters
2.2.22-114.asw_2: They only apply to small transporters with open loading space
2.2.22-114.asw_3: They only apply to small transporters without separation wall to the loading space
2.2.22-114.info: The load securing regulations apply to all motor vehicles and thus also to vans.
2.2.22-114.text: Do the requirements for properly securing of loads apply to all small transporters?

2.2.23-031.asw_1: Having the radio on too loud
2.2.23-031.info: Loud noises may prevent warning signals from being heard. Such loud noises include a radio that is too loud, the use of headphones and a loud exhaust system as sources of noise.
2.2.23-031.text: What can prevent you from hearing warning signals?

2.2.23-034.asw_1: They must be securely attached at the appropriate places
2.2.23-034.asw_2: They must always be easily legible
2.2.23-034.asw_3: The rear registration plates must be lit up in darkness
2.2.23-034.info: The registration plates must be fixed to the front and rear of the motor vehicle. In addition, they must be legible at all times, which is why, for example, dirt must be removed. At night, illumination of the rear registration plate is required.
2.2.23-034.text: What is important with regard to the official registration plates?

2.2.23-035.asw_1: - may no longer be used in road traffic
2.2.23-035.asw_2: - must be de-registered at the registration centre
2.2.23-035.asw_3: - must be submitted to the registration centre
2.2.23-035.info: Participation in public road traffic without liability insurance is not permitted. If the insurance coverage expires, this information must be submitted to the registration centre.
2.2.23-035.text: What is required when your vehicle is no longer covered by motor liability insurance?

2.2.23-036.asw_2: Attach a protective foil for the lettering
2.2.23-036.info: Changes to the licence plate or number plates are not permitted.
2.2.23-036.text: What are you allowed to change on the official registration plate?

2.2.23-101.asw_1: The canvass covers must not obstruct the driver's rear view through the outside mirrors
2.2.23-101.asw_2: Unloaded trailers with high canvass cover superstructure are particularly sensitive to side wind
2.2.23-101.asw_3: When vehicles have canvass covers, a load must not be specially secured
2.2.23-101.info: The driver's vision must not be restricted, including that vision provided by mirrors. Canvas covers provide additional surface, which increases sensitivity to side winds.
2.2.23-101.text: What must be remembered with regard to vehicles with canvass covers?

2.2.23-103.info: The first step is to familiarise yourself with the vehicle and adjust the seat, headrest and safety belt correctly. As soon as the seating position has been finally determined, the mirrors must be adjusted.
2.2.23-103.text: What must you adjust when driving a vehicle which is not your own?

2.2.23-104.asw_2: Engage first gear or reverse gear
2.2.23-104.asw_3: Put the gear lever in neutral position
2.2.23-104.info: In the case of vehicles equipped with a manual gearbox, first gear or reverse gear should be engaged to prevent the vehicle from rolling away. In addition, the parking brake should be applied on a slope.
2.2.23-104.text: How do you secure a car with a manual gearbox against rolling away on a downhill slope?

2.2.23-105.asw_2: Put the selector lever in the "P" position
2.2.23-105.asw_3: Put the selector lever in the "N" position
2.2.23-105.info: In vehicles with automatic transmission, the selector lever must be set to "P" to prevent the vehicle from rolling away. The parking brake can be applied for additional safety.
2.2.23-105.text: How do you secure a car with automatic transmission against rolling away on a downhill slope?

2.2.23-107.info: Wiper blades that are worn out cannot be relied upon in wet conditions; there is a risk of streaks forming. Smeared windows make it difficult to detect objects clearly. The load can block vision, especially when the motorist must use the mirrors.
2.2.23-107.text: What can interfere with your view?

2.2.23-113.asw_2: Put wheel chocks in front of the wheels
2.2.23-113.asw_3: Put one wheel chock in front and one behind the same wheel
2.2.23-113.info: Wheel chocks must be fitted in front of the wheels to counteract the force of slope downforce. The parking brake must also be applied.
2.2.23-113.text: A single axle caravan with overrun brake is parked on a downhill slope. How do you have to secure it to prevent it from rolling away?

2.2.26-102.asw_1: Move slightly forward or backward in order to clear the crossing as quickly as possible
2.2.26-102.asw_2: Move half onto the footpath in order to clear the crossing
2.2.26-102.asw_3: Reverse under no circumstances, even though the roadway is clear behind you
2.2.26-102.info: Pedestrian crossings must be kept clear. If a crossing is blocked due to the flow of traffic, it must be cleared as much as possible. If driving forward is not possible, check whether it is possible to reverse carefully.
2.2.26-102.text: You come to a stop unexpectedly on a pedestrian crossing. What do you do?

2.2.32-101.asw_1: You, as you have caused it
2.2.32-101.asw_3: The persons living along this section of the road
2.2.32-101.info: It is prohibited to dirty or wet the road or to place or leave objects on it if this may endanger or impede traffic. Whoever is responsible for such obstructions must immediately remove the obstruction and make it sufficiently recognizable before its removal. The dirt must be removed so that there is no danger to other motorists.
2.2.32-101.text: You are entering a public road e.g. from a field or building site and considerably soil the road. Who is responsible for eliminating this traffic obstruction?

2.2.32-102.asw_2: - secure the danger spot and immediately inform the road service or police
2.2.32-102.asw_3: - proceed and inform the nearest municipal office
2.2.32-102.info: It is prohibited to dirty or wet the road or to place or leave objects on the road if this may endanger or impede traffic. Whoever is responsible for the traffic-infringing obstruction must immediately remove the obstruction and make it sufficiently recognizable before its removal. Equipment and cargo parts must be removed so that other motorists are not endangered.
2.2.32-102.text: What must you do to avoid endangering others by equipment or load which has fallen off your vehicle?

2.2.37-002.info: The braking distance is 16 m according to the rule of thumb and the reaction distance is 12 m, which results in a stopping distance of 28 m. Therefore, the crossing should be crossed quickly.
2.2.37-002.text: You are travelling at a speed of approximately 40 km/h. The lights change from "green" to "amber" when you are 10 m away. What do you do?

2.2.37-003.info: The braking distance is 16 m according to the rule of thumb and the reaction distance is 12 m, which results in a stopping distance of 28 m. Considering the distance to the traffic light, the driver should stop.
2.2.37-003.text: You are travelling at a speed of approximately 40 km/h. The lights change from "green" to "amber" when you are 40 m away. What do you do?

2.2.37-004.asw_2: Approach but be ready to stop
2.2.37-004.asw_3: Accelerate even though the speed limit is exceeded
2.2.37-004.info: The traffic light can switch to yellow at any time. Therefore, it is important to keep a good eye on the traffic light. The motorist should be ready to brake if necessary and to bring the vehicle to a standstill.
2.2.37-004.text: You are approaching a traffic light which has been "green" for some time. What do you do?

2.4.40-002.asw_1: Increase your alertness and, as a matter of precaution, increase your distance to the vehicle in front
2.4.40-002.asw_2: In case of a traffic jam, brake and switch on hazard warning lights
2.4.40-002.asw_3: In case of a traffic jam, move over onto the hard shoulder and proceed
2.4.40-002.info: Increase attention and increase the distance to the vehicle in front. If you see a traffic jam, slow down and switch on the hazard warning lights.
2.4.40-002.text: What do you do when you see this traffic sign on an autobahn?

2.4.40-003.asw_2: Drive as far as possible over on the right-hand side
2.4.40-003.info: The sign alerting of a potentially dangerous “Kurve” warns of an unexpected or tight bend. You must reduce your speed so that no excessive centrifugal forces occur in the bend. In addition, drive far to the right in order to prevent possible collisions with oncoming traffic.
2.4.40-003.text: What must you do when you see this traffic sign?

2.4.40-004.asw_1: Drive more slowly, watch out for wild animals
2.4.40-004.asw_2: Dip the headlights and brake when you see wild animals
2.4.40-004.asw_3: Do not avoid hitting wild animals if oncoming traffic would be endangered
2.4.40-004.info: The danger sign "Wildwechsel" warns of wild animals that may enter the road. It is necessary to adjust the speed to be ready to brake in order to stop the vehicle in time in an emergency. When sighting wild animals, you must dim your lights and slow down. You should not swerve in order to avoid the animal if this can be avoided, because collisions with oncoming traffic may occur.
2.4.40-004.text: What do you do within this danger section?

2.4.41-101.info: The traffic sign prescribes the use of snow chains. The maximum authorised speed for motor vehicles equipped with snow chains is 50 km/h, even under the most favourable conditions.
2.4.41-101.text: What must you remember when you see this traffic sign?

2.4.41-102.info: If a mass such as '7,5 t' is indicated on an additional sign, the prohibition shall apply only if the maximum authorised mass of such means of transport exceeds the limit indicated. If the mass is not indicated on an additional sign, but it is indicated on the primary sign, the actual mass applies.
2.4.41-102.text: Which traffic sign refers to the permissible total mass?

2.4.41-103.info: If the mass is specifically indicated on the traffic sign, the actual weight of the vehicle or combination applies. If a symbol is shown, however, the permissible total weight applies.
2.4.41-103.text: Which traffic sign refers to the actual mass?

2.4.41-104.asw_1: - with an actual axle weight exceeding 2 t
2.4.41-104.asw_2: - with a permissible axle weight exceeding 2 t
2.4.41-104.asw_3: - with a permissible total weight not exceeding 2 t
2.4.41-104.info: The symbol of an axle on the traffic sign indicates that the mass specification does not refer to the total mass of the vehicle, but to the axle load. If the mass is not indicated on an additional sign, but it is indicated on the primary traffic sign, the actual axle load applies.
2.4.41-104.text: Which vehicles are prohibited from using a road sign-posted like this?

2.4.41-105.asw_1: A prohibition for vehicles more than 2 m wide including load
2.4.41-105.asw_3: You must keep a lateral distance of at least 2 m from other vehicles
2.4.41-105.info: The width of the passage is limited. The width of the vehicle shall not exceed 2 metres. When determining the width of the vehicle, the exterior mirrors must be taken into account.
2.4.41-105.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.41-106.asw_1: Length 8 m, width 2.5 m, height 4 m
2.4.41-106.asw_2: Length 10 m, width 3.9 m, height 3 m
2.4.41-106.asw_3: Length 4 m, width 2.5 m, height 2.5 m
2.4.41-106.asw_pretext: Vehicles of the following dimensions, including load:
2.4.41-106.info: The passage is limited in height. The traffic sign indicates the height that must not be exceeded by the vehicle and its load.
2.4.41-106.text: Which vehicles can cause serious accidents when this traffic sign is ignored?

2.4.41-107.asw_1: Car with caravan trailer, total length of the combination 11 m
2.4.41-107.asw_2: Tractor with trailer, total length of the combination 12 m
2.4.41-107.asw_3: Truck with a length of 9 m including load
2.4.41-107.info: The traffic sign prohibits the participation in traffic of vehicles whose dimensions including load exceed the specified actual limit of 10 metres. The prohibition applies to vehicle combinations for the total length. The truck shown serves only as a symbol; the traffic sign also applies to other vehicles and combinations.
2.4.41-107.text: With which vehicles are you not allowed to drive on a road sign-posted like this?

2.4.42-001.asw_2: The end of the clearway for motor vehicles only
2.4.42-001.info: The "End of the autobahn" traffic sign indicates the end of the autobahn.
2.4.42-001.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.42-002.asw_1: The end of the clearway for motor vehicles only
2.4.42-002.info: The "End of the clearway for motor vehicles only" traffic sign indicates the end of the clearway for motor vehicles only.
2.4.42-002.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.42-004.asw_2: The distance to the next petrol station
2.4.42-004.asw_3: The number of a European road
2.4.42-004.info: The "Autobahnen" traffic sign indicates the number of the respective autobahn.
2.4.42-004.text: What do such traffic signs indicate?

2.4.42-005.asw_3: The distance from the exit to Düsseldorf-Benrath
2.4.42-005.info: The "autobahn junctions" traffic sign indicates the number of the autobahn exit.
2.4.42-005.text: What does the figure "26" indicate in this traffic sign?

2.4.42-006.asw_1: A diversion for autobahn traffic when required
2.4.42-006.info: The "diversion is required" sign indicates an alternative route in the subordinate road network between motorway junctions.
2.4.42-006.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.42-007.asw_2: Free choice of marked driving lanes for motor vehicles with a permissible total mass up to 3.5 t
2.4.42-007.asw_3: Free choice of marked driving lanes for all motor vehicles
2.4.42-007.info: The sign giving a town or villages name traffic sign indicates the beginning of a built-up area. A maximum speed of 50 km/h is permitted. Only vehicles with a permissible total mass of up to 3.5 t have free choice of lanes.
2.4.42-007.text: What applies from this traffic sign onwards?

2.4.42-101.asw_1: You may not sound your horn to signal your intention to overtake
2.4.42-101.asw_2: Parking cars may be safely marked with parking light
2.4.42-101.asw_3: You may drive with parking light in the darkness
2.4.42-101.info: The sign giving a town or villages name traffic sign indicates the beginning of a built-up area. Sound and light signals may only be given by those who overtake outside built-up areas or who see themselves or others endangered. In built-up areas, it is sufficient to mark only the side of the vehicle facing the road with parking lamps or other approved means; separate lighting is not required if the street lighting makes the vehicle clearly visible at a sufficient distance.
2.4.42-101.text: What applies from this traffic sign onwards?

2.4.42-102.asw_1: The car as shown in the picture
2.4.42-102.asw_2: The caravan as shown in the picture
2.4.42-102.asw_3: Small cars also diagonally to the driving direction
2.4.42-102.info: The "Parking on sidewalks" sign permits vehicles with a permissible total mass of 2.8 t (and thus also caravans as a rule) to park in the manner shown.
2.4.42-102.text: How are vehicles with a permissible total mass up to 2.8 t allowed to be parked here?

2.4.43-002.asw_1: Nearest emergency call telephone in the direction of the arrow
2.4.43-002.asw_2: Nearest car park in the direction of the arrow
2.4.43-002.asw_3: Next exit in the direction of the arrow
2.4.43-002.info: The arrow indicates the direction in which the next emergency call telephone is located.
2.4.43-002.text: You need assistance on the autobahn. Which information does the arrow on the roadside marker give you?

2.5.01-006.asw_1: By driving with a defective exhaust
2.5.01-006.asw_2: By "playing" with the accelerator when standing still
2.5.01-006.asw_3: By sounding your horn when in danger
2.5.01-006.info: A defective exhaust system generates unnecessary noise. The same applies to playing with the throttle, because it unnecessarily accelerates the engine to high revs and thus raises the noise level.

2.5.01-007.asw_1: Because the noise you cause annoys others
2.5.01-007.asw_3: Because this is a great strain on the rear brake
2.5.01-007.info: When starting sharply, the motor is quickly brought to a high speed, which generates unnecessary noise. The tyre wear is increased, which is not necessary.
2.5.01-007.text: Why should you avoid driving off at a rapid pace?

2.5.01-102.asw_1: A catalytic converter can be damaged or destroyed when the car is towed to start
2.5.01-102.asw_2: A catalytic converter can be damaged when the engine starts after many unsuccessful attempts
2.5.01-102.asw_3: Unburned fuel in the catalytic converter cannot cause any damage when the engine starts
2.5.01-102.info: A catalytic converter is threatened with destruction if unburned fuel flows into it. This can happen when towing the vehicle. The risk also exists in the case of numerous failed start attempts.
2.5.01-102.text: What must you know about catalytic converters?

2.5.01-105.asw_3: By avoiding roads with frequent traffic jams
2.5.01-105.info: Avoiding traffic peaks means avoiding "stop-and-go traffic" or frequent stopping and starting, thus reducing fuel consumption. Avoiding roads with regular traffic jams has the same effect. Carpooling results in fewer vehicles on the roads and thus relieves the burden on the environment.
2.5.01-105.text: How can you keep the burden on the environment low?

2.5.01-106.asw_1: A roof rack or ski rack
2.5.01-106.info: Roof racks and ski racks increase air resistance and thus increase fuel consumption. Unused items increase the vehicle weight and thus have a negative effect on consumption.
2.5.01-106.text: What results in increased fuel consumption of your car?

2.5.01-107.asw_1: By observing at least the tyre pressure indicated in the owner's manual
2.5.01-107.asw_2: By removing roof racks or ski racks
2.5.01-107.info: Roof racks and ski racks increase air resistance and thus fuel consumption. The same applies to tyres whose pressure is not correctly adjusted.

2.5.01-109.asw_1: Changing to public transport at collective parking areas ("P + R")
2.5.01-109.asw_3: Switching off the engine in a traffic jam
2.5.01-109.info: Carpools are environmentally sound because they reduce the number of vehicles on the road. Switching off the engine in traffic jams prevents unnecessary combustion of fuel. Collective parking areas are a good way to set up carpools or use public transport.
2.5.01-109.text: Which conduct shows awareness of the environment?

2.5.01-111.asw_1: By driving in 4th or 5th gear in built-up areas
2.5.01-111.asw_2: By driving at high engine revolutions
2.5.01-111.info: Driving in high gears results in low revs and thus reduces noise generation.

2.5.01-117.asw_1: Clearly visible on the inside of the windscreen
2.5.01-117.asw_2: Clearly visible on the outside of the windscreen
2.5.01-117.asw_3: Clearly visible on the inside of the rear window
2.5.01-117.info: To identify a motor vehicle, the sticker must be affixed visibly to the inside of the windscreen. The sticker should be affixed to the area on the lower right (from the driver's perspective).
2.5.01-117.text: Where do you have to place the emissions sticker for identifying lowemission vehicles?

2.6.01-106.asw_1: The date indicated on the test stamp must be observed
2.6.01-106.asw_2: The date indicated on the test stamp is extended by the time the caravan was stationary on the campground
2.6.01-106.info: The actual use has no influence on the date of the main inspection. The old date remains valid.
2.6.01-106.text: You have left your registered caravan trailer for six months during the winter on a campground. What applies as far as the official inspection (Hauptuntersuchung) is concerned?

2.6.02-104.asw_pretext: A trailer with a permissible total mass of
2.6.02-104.info: In the case of a category B driving licence, the total permissible mass of the car and trailer may not exceed 3,500 kg. In this case, only a trailer with a maximum permissible total mass of 1,100 kg can be considered (3,500 kg - 2,400 kg = 1,100 kg). Accordingly, the trailer with a permissible total mass of 1,000 kg must be selected.
2.6.02-104.text: You are holding a driving permit class B. Your car has the following specifications: - empty mass 1900 kg - permissible total mass 2400 kg - permissible towed load 1500 kg Which trailer are you allowed to tow?

2.6.03-105.asw_1: The actual total mass of the trailer must not exceed the towed load permitted for the car
2.6.03-105.asw_2: The breakaway cable is connected to the towing vehicle
2.6.03-105.asw_3: The permissible maximum speed for this combination of vehicles is 60 km/h, including on autobahns
2.6.03-105.info: A trailer may only be carried if the permissible trailer load is not exceeded. It is necessary to establish a connection between the car and the trailer using the breakaway cable.
2.6.03-105.text: What must you remember when you want to use a trailer with overrun brakes behind your car?

2.6.03-106.asw_2: The permissible total mass of the trailer
2.6.03-106.asw_3: The useful load of the trailer
2.6.03-106.info: The towed load is the load that is actually pulled.
2.6.03-106.text: What is designated as towed load?

2.7.01-043.asw_1: As a rule, the effect of disc brakes starts later than on a dry road surface
2.7.01-043.asw_2: As a rule, the effect of disc brakes starts earlier than on a dry road surface
2.7.01-043.info: A wet road surface has a negative effect on the behaviour of the disc brakes, the braking effect occurs later.
2.7.01-043.text: What particular characteristics of disc brakes must you remember when driving on a wet road surface?

2.7.01-045.asw_1: Load/Number of passengers in the car
2.7.01-045.info: If possible, the tyre pressure should be checked with cold tyres, as tyre pressure is influenced by temperature. The load/occupancy of the vehicle also has an effect. Because of this, the higher the cargo load, the higher the tyre pressure should be set.
2.7.01-045.text: What must you take into consideration when checking tyre pressure?

2.7.01-046.info: If the speed is doubled, the centrifugal force increases fourfold. The formula for the calculation is as follows: F = m x ((v x v) / r) (F = centrifugal force; m = vehicle mass; v = speed; r = curve radius)
2.7.01-046.text: You drive round a bend once at 30 km/h and again at 60 km/h. How does the centrifugal force change?

2.7.01-047.info: On the one hand, the strength of the centrifugal force depends on the speed. The higher the speed, the greater the centrifugal force. On the other hand, it depends on the curve radius. The tighter the curve, the higher the centrifugal force.
2.7.01-047.text: What increases the effect of centrifugal force on the vehicle when driving round bends?

2.7.01-102.asw_1: The distance for overtaking increases considerably
2.7.01-102.asw_2: Hasty movements of the steering wheel increase the danger of skidding
2.7.01-102.asw_3: The braking distance is reduced considerably
2.7.01-102.info: Caravan trailers react to hasty steering and threaten to break out. Due to the length of the train, the overtaking distance is longer. The additional weight and increased drag can further extend the overtaking distance.
2.7.01-102.text: What changes when a caravan trailer is towed?

2.7.01-103.asw_1: More space is needed when turning and driving round bends
2.7.01-103.info: The trailer leads to a higher total weight and increases air resistance, which reduces the capacity to accelerate. Due to the increased length, more space is needed in curves and thus also when turning, e.g., for the swing.
2.7.01-103.text: What changes in a car when towing a two-axle trailer?

2.7.01-104.asw_1: Think about the length of your car and trailer combination
2.7.01-104.asw_3: Warn oncoming traffic by flashing your lights
2.7.01-104.info: The trailer leads to a higher total weight and increases air resistance, which reduces the capacity to accelerate. Due to the increased length, more space is needed in curves and thus also when turning, also when overtaking. It also takes longer to cross the line of oncoming traffic.
2.7.01-104.text: You are in your car towing a trailer on a road with oncoming traffic and want to turn left. What must you particularly remember when you set off again?

2.7.01-105.asw_1: Reduce speed, if necessary, engage low gear in time, be ready to brake
2.7.01-105.asw_2: Make allowance for the pushing effect of the trailer
2.7.01-105.asw_3: Relieve the car brakes by disengaging the clutch at frequent intervals
2.7.01-105.info: On slopes, the trailer can develop a thrust effect, which must thus be taken into account. An adapted speed and a lower gear help to counter the effect of the thrust.
2.7.01-105.text: You are in your car towing a trailer which has no brakes and you approach a long steep downhill slope. What is correct?

2.7.01-107.asw_1: Whether the lights of the trailer are working
2.7.01-107.asw_2: Whether the view through the rear-view mirrors is adequate
2.7.01-107.asw_3: Whether the passengers in the caravan trailer have put on their safety belts
2.7.01-107.info: Before starting the journey, check that all the lights on the caravan are working. If the mirrors do not provide sufficient visibility, additional mirrors must be fitted.
2.7.01-107.text: What must you check on a car with a caravan trailer before setting out on a journey?

2.7.01-108.info: Due to the additional mass, the trailer provides a thrust effect that extends the braking distance.
2.7.01-108.text: You are in your car towing a fully loaded trailer which has no brakes. What is correct?

2.7.01-109.asw_1: If the permissible trailer load or the permissible coupling of the car are exceeded
2.7.01-109.asw_2: If additional rear-view mirrors must be mounted because of the width of the trailer
2.7.01-109.asw_3: If the trailer is licensed to transport passengers
2.7.01-109.info: Before towing a (residential) trailer, check that the permissible axle and drawbar load is not exceeded. The caravan could restrict the view through the mirrors. If this is the case, additional mirrors must be fitted.
2.7.01-109.text: You want to tow a singe-axle caravan trailer behind your car. What must you check?

2.7.01-110.asw_1: When selecting a gear, the car must, as a rule, be held by the service brakes
2.7.01-110.asw_2: The selector lever must only be moved when the engine has stopped
2.7.01-110.asw_3: The engine revolutions must be raised considerably so that the engine does not stall
2.7.01-110.info: As soon as the driving gear is engaged, the vehicle will start driving. This is why the gear selector lever can only be operated when the service brake is applied in most automatic vehicles.
2.7.01-110.text: You want to set off in an automatic car (hydraulic converter). What must you know?

2.7.01-111.asw_1: To check the air pressure regularly, including that of the spare wheel
2.7.01-111.asw_2: To increase the pressure to the level stated in the vehicle manual when the vehicle is heavily loaded
2.7.01-111.asw_3: To reduce the air pressure before longer trips
2.7.01-111.info: To avoid driving with too high or too low tyre pressure, the tyre pressure must be regularly checked – including the pressure of the spare wheel. A high cargo load requires a higher tyre pressure. It must be adjusted according to the vehicle manufacturer's specifications.
2.7.01-111.text: What must you remember with regard to tyre pressure?

2.7.01-112.asw_2: Driving longer than necessary with the emergency wheel
2.7.01-112.info: Due to their design, most emergency wheels may only be ridden at speeds of up to 80 km/h. The emergency wheel is not a permanent replacement. It may only be driven as far as absolutely necessary.
2.7.01-112.text: You had a tyre failure and must mount the emergency wheel. What is prohibited when you continue to drive?

2.7.01-115.asw_1: The rear end tends to turn out to the side
2.7.01-115.asw_2: The front end tends to turn out to the side
2.7.01-115.info: Cars with rear wheel drive tend to oversteer, i.e., the rear tends to turn out to the side if the motorist accelerates too much in a curve.
2.7.01-115.text: What does a rear-wheel drive car tend to do if you accelerate too much on a bend?

2.7.01-118.asw_2: Reduced danger of sliding sideways when setting off on a slippery roadway
2.7.01-118.asw_3: No locking of the wheels when braking
2.7.01-118.info: An anti-slip device (ASR) prevents the wheels from spinning when starting due to too much throttle. Even when starting off on a slippery road, more safety is offered and the risk of breaking out sideways is reduced.
2.7.01-118.text: What are the advantages of an anti-slip device (ASR)?

2.7.01-120.asw_1: The claw of the coupling must fit securely around the ball. The locking device must engage
2.7.01-120.asw_3: The jack wheel must be set so that it can also run when driving
2.7.01-120.info: A complete set-up of the hitch is essential to ensure a safe connection between the trailer and the vehicle. Such a connection can be recognized by the fact that the ball is engaged in the coupler. In addition, an electrical connection must be established. The signal lamps can only function if the trailer cable is plugged in.
2.7.01-120.text: You want to couple up a trailer with ball coupling. What is correct?

2.7.01-121.asw_1: Check that the brakes are working
2.7.01-121.asw_2: Raise the jack wheel, if fitted, to the highest setting
2.7.01-121.asw_3: Attach the brakeaway cable to the coupling of the motor vehicle
2.7.01-121.info: After coupling, the breakaway rope must be connected to the trailer coupling so that it releases the brake on the trailer in the event of an emergency. The function of the brake on the trailer must be checked in order to be able to safely participate in road traffic. The jack wheel should be moved to its uppermost position.
2.7.01-121.text: What must you do after coupling up a single-axle trailer with overrun brakes?

2.7.01-122.info: For safe operation, the permissible support load must not be exceeded. The same applies to the permissible axle load. The permissible total mass of the train must be taken into account, and exceeding it is not permitted.
2.7.01-122.text: What must you bear in mind when loading a single-axle trailer?

2.7.01-123.asw_2: Place wheel chocks under the wheels
2.7.01-123.info: Use the parking brake to secure the trailer against rolling away. Wheel chocks should be placed in front of the wheels to provide additional protection.
2.7.01-123.text: You want to park your single-axle trailer (overrun brakes, 1000 kg permissible total mass) on a slope. What must you do?

2.7.01-124.asw_1: The brakes may not work because of rust
2.7.01-124.asw_3: Tyre pressure may have increased greatly due to exposure to the sun
2.7.01-124.info: If it is not used for a longer period of time, brakes often tend to become rusty, which drastically reduces the braking effect. Cable connections may also be damaged, which means that the trailer lights no longer work.
2.7.01-124.text: Which dangerous defects can have occurred on a trailer with overrun brakes which has been parked for some time?

2.7.01-125.asw_2: - must not project more than 1 m beyond the rear reflectors, unless specially marked
2.7.01-125.asw_3: - must not project more than 1 m beyond the front of the towing vehicle
2.7.01-125.info: Other motorists must not be endangered. For this reason, the cargo must always be stowed safely. If there is no marking, the load must not extend more than 1 m beyond the reflectors.
2.7.01-125.text: What must you remember when loading a trailer?

2.7.01-127.asw_1: Because the braking action of the engine will have no effect
2.7.01-127.asw_2: Because this causes unnecessary wear of the brakes
2.7.01-127.asw_3: Because in this case the brake servo unit will no longer function
2.7.01-127.info: The engine provides a supportive braking effect when driving downhill. However, this is omitted when the clutch is pushed. As a result, the brakes have to be applied even more strongly, which increases their wear.
2.7.01-127.text: Why should you not apply the clutch when driving on a long, steep downhill slope?

2.7.02-015.info: The tread depth can be determined during tyre inspection. The same applies to whether the tread pattern is worn evenly. The age can also be read from the tyre.
2.7.02-015.text: What can you check on your tyre?

2.7.02-020.asw_1: When you drive a different vehicle
2.7.02-020.asw_2: If a vehicle has not been used for a longer period
2.7.02-020.asw_3: Each time the engine oil is changed
2.7.02-020.info: Different vehicles may be unfamiliar, including their braking behaviour. By means of an early brake test, an initial feeling for the brake system can be developed. After a prolonged standing time, there is a risk of reduced braking power, which must be detected in a timely manner.
2.7.02-020.text: In which cases is it imperative to test the brakes?

2.7.02-021.info: A regular check of the air pressure is necessary to avoid driving at too low a pressure. External damage should also be detected at an early stage, otherwise this could lead to tyre bursting. Regular checking of the tread pattern should ensure that the tyre does not fall below the minimum tread depth.
2.7.02-021.text: What do you have to check the tyres on your vehicle at regular intervals for?

2.7.02-027.asw_2: Because parts of the exhaust system can drop on the roadway
2.7.02-027.info: A rusted exhaust system generates unnecessary noise that can annoy other people. There is a risk that parts of the exhaust system may come loose and fall onto the road while driving, potentially endangering other motorists.
2.7.02-027.text: Why are you required to have a defective exhaust system repaired immediately?

2.7.02-028.info: An unusually loud exhaust may indicate a problem such as a defect due to wear. Consequently, the exhaust system should be checked.
2.7.02-028.text: The noise of the exhaust has suddenly become louder than usual. What do you do?

2.7.02-029.asw_2: The horn's operating device is defective
2.7.02-029.info: If the horn does not work, the control device or the contact on the steering wheel or handlebar may be defective. It is also possible that a fuse may have blown.
2.7.02-029.text: If the horn does not work, what can be the reason?

2.7.02-107.asw_1: Your car can veer to the side
2.7.02-107.info: If the brake acts strongly on one side, laterally acting centrifugal forces can occur that cause the vehicle to veer out. At the same time, the braking power is reduced, which increases the braking distance.
2.7.02-107.text: The brakes on your car are pulling strongly to one side. What effects can this have when you are braking?

2.7.02-109.asw_3: It is sufficient to fill up the brake fluid
2.7.02-109.info: There seems to be a serious defect in the brake system. Since safe participation in traffic is not possible in this way, the vehicle must be parked immediately. Then the defect must be professionally repaired.
2.7.02-109.text: When you press on the brake pedal, it touches the floor. Only when you press on it several times does the pedal travel become shorter. What must you do?

2.7.02-112.info: Defective brake lights impair safe participation in road traffic. Therefore, the lights must be repaired immediately.
2.7.02-112.text: The brake lights do not function. What do you do?

2.7.02-113.asw_1: The indicator signal light will flash faster than usual
2.7.02-113.asw_2: You cannot detect a defective indicator lamp while driving
2.7.02-113.info: If the light bulb of a flasher is defective, this is indicated by the indicator light flashing faster.
2.7.02-113.text: How can you tell while driving that an indicator lamp is not working?

2.7.02-114.asw_1: The headlamps on your vehicle are set incorrectly and are dazzling
2.7.02-114.asw_2: The light range adjustment is not adapted to your vehicle load
2.7.02-114.asw_3: Other drivers are telling you to turn on your main beam
2.7.02-114.info: The oncoming traffic seems to be dazzled. This may be caused by incorrectly adjusted headlights. It is also possible that the headlamp levelling control is set incorrectly or has not been adapted to the load condition.

2.1.11-125.asw_3: The state of the road surface
2.1.11-125.info: Overtaking is only allowed if you can ensure that no obstruction of oncoming traffic will take place during the entire overtaking process. Overtaking is not permitted if the traffic situation is unclear. In this case, there is regular oncoming traffic. In addition, the traffic situation is unclear because the view of the roadway is severely restricted by trees.
2.1.11-125.text: You want to overtake. Why should you not do so?

2.2.15-112.asw_1: - the hazard lights must be switched on on both vehicles
2.2.15-112.asw_2: - the towing cable should be kept as taut as possible
2.2.15-112.asw_3: - the motorway may only be used to shorten the journey to the next car garage
2.2.15-112.info: While being towed, both vehicles must have their hazard warning lights switched on. The towing cable should be kept as taut as possible to prevent damage (e.g., due to a strong jolt or grinding on the road surface).
2.2.15-112.text: You car has a fault and can no longer be driven. What must you be aware of during towing?

2.6.02-030.asw_2: An entry into the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders
2.6.02-030.asw_3: The loss of my insurance cover
2.6.02-030.info: Participation in public road traffic with a vehicle whose operating license has expired can be punished with a fine. In addition, there is a threat of entry into the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders. In addition, a loss of insurance coverage is to be expected.
2.6.02-030.text: A technical modification to your vehicle means that the operating licence is extinguished. What consequences should you anticipate if you nevertheless use the vehicle on public roads?

2.8.01-009.asw_1: An order to attend an advanced seminar for new drivers
2.8.01-009.asw_2: Entry into the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders
2.8.01-009.asw_3: An order to resit a theoretical driving licence test
2.8.01-009.info: Failure to observe the traffic sign constitutes a serious infringement during the probationary period. There is the threat of an order to participate in an advanced seminar for new drivers and an entry in the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders.
2.8.01-009.text: You are currently in the probationary period and to date have not come to the attention of the authorities. What consequences may result if you fail to observe the traffic sign "Stop. Give way." and thereby endanger other road users?

2.8.01-010.asw_1: A more considerate and risk-conscious attitude to driving on public roads
2.8.01-010.asw_3: Reducing the number of points in the Central Register of Road Traffic Offenders
2.8.01-010.info: The focus of an advanced seminar is the attitude towards road traffic. Participants should be sensitised to behave more considerately in traffic later on. In addition, the detection of traffic hazards is to be improved.
2.8.01-010.text: What should be achieved by attending an advanced seminar during the probationary period?

2.1.03-115.asw_3: I switch to the left lane now
2.1.03-115.info: The visibility conditions are not good; the road surface could be slippery and the lane could be affected by heavy snowdrifts. It is not possible to merge to the left because another vehicle is overtaking. Therefore, it is necessary to slow down and wait at the obstacle.
2.1.03-115.text: What is the right course of action?

2.1.03-116-M.asw_3: - drive to the left past the damaged road surface
2.1.03-116-M.info: Due to the path of the road and the vegetation, visibility is severely restricted and the road surface is poor. There may be an obstacle on the road, which is why it is necessary to reduce your speed. It is necessary to stay in your lane. Merging into another lane would hardly improve visibility, whilst increasing the risk of collision with oncoming traffic.

2.1.02-003.asw_1: Because someone is walking onto the road
2.1.02-003.asw_2: Because passengers are exiting the tram
2.1.02-003.asw_3: Because the truck is switching into my lane
2.1.02-003.info: A person is running onto the road in front of the truck and could cross the lane. In order not to endanger this pedestrian, it is necessary to brake.
2.1.02-003.text: Why do you have to brake?

2.1.03-028.asw_2: I drive over to the right-side as far as possible
2.1.03-028.asw_3: I remain in the centre of my lane
2.1.03-028.info: A pedestrian forces the oncoming truck to pull out. It cuts into the road, which is why you have to brake and drive as far to the right as possible.
2.1.03-028.text: What is the right course of action?

2.1.03-029.info: Due to the high snowfall at the edge of the road, both your own visibility and the visibility of the green car is impaired. It seems as if the green car will cross the road immediately. It is thus necessary to brake and defuse the dangerous situation.

2.1.03-030.info: The road is very narrow and there is a truck approaching. It may be necessary to stop first and find a safe solution in order to pass.

2.1.07-020.asw_1: I continue driving as far to the right as possible
2.1.07-020.asw_3: I move into the left-hand lane
2.1.07-020.info: There is a driver approaching in the wrong direction. Driving as far to the right as possible reduces the risk of a collision. In addition, you must brake in order to further reduce the risk.

2.1.08-016.asw_2: I switch on my hazard lights
2.1.08-016.asw_3: I continue driving in the clear lane
2.1.08-016.info: There is a traffic jam. It is necessary to slow down in order to approach the end of the congestion carefully. By switching on the hazard warning light, the following traffic will be warned of the danger.

2.1.08-017.asw_1: With an obstacle situated around the corner
2.1.08-017.asw_2: That the bend will become tighter as it progresses
2.1.08-017.asw_3: With oncoming traffic on my lane
2.1.08-017.info: The layout of the bend can only be guessed; it could still narrow. The bend is difficult to see because of the vegetation. An obstacle on the road cannot be ruled out.
2.1.08-017.text: What should you anticipate with this bend?

2.2.18-013.asw_1: - as far to the right as possible
2.2.18-013.asw_2: - as far to the left as possible
2.2.18-013.asw_pretext: I continue driving on my lane
2.2.18-013.info: On a three-lane motorway, the rescue lane is formed between the left and middle lanes. It is thus important to drive as far to the right as possible.

2.2.18-014.asw_2: I get in line on the hard shoulder
2.2.18-014.asw_3: I stop on my lane and wait for a gap
2.2.18-014.info: A traffic jam has formed on the exit lane that protrudes into the hard shoulder. Driving on the hard shoulder is not permitted, which is why it is necessary to continue driving in order to use the next exit, for example.

2.4.42-103.info: The "hydrogen filling station" symbol indicates a hydrogen filling station.

2.4.42-104.info: The "natural gas filling station" symbol indicates a natural gas filling station.
2.4.42-104.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.42-105.info: The "Autogastankstelle" (auto gas filling station) sign indicates an auto gas filling station.
2.4.42-105.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.42-106.asw_3: A facility for charging mobile telephones

2.4.42-106.text: What does this traffic sign indicate?

2.4.42-107.asw_1: A carpark with connections to public transport ("Park + Ride")
2.4.42-107.asw_2: A filling station with carwash ("Care + Clean")

2.5.01-011.info: Winter tyres are designed for driving at low temperatures. Tyre wear increases at higher temperatures. At the same time, high rolling resistances occur, resulting in higher fuel consumption.
2.5.01-011.text: What is caused by driving with winter tyres during the summer months?

2.5.01-013.info: Waste water is treated at a carwash, which noticeably reduces the burden on the environment.

2.5.01-014.info: Electric consumption also increases fuel consumption because this subjects the alternator to greater demands. Accordingly, the activation of heated seating leads to higher fuel consumption. A switched on air conditioner has the same effect.
2.5.01-014.text: What increases the fuel consumption of your vehicle considerably?

2.6.03-001.asw_1: If the line-of-sight is broken to the person directing, the vehicle must be stopped
2.6.03-001.asw_2: A person directing is only required when driving into a priority road
2.6.03-001.asw_3: A person directing is not needed when on a factory premises
2.6.03-001.info: Anyone driving a vehicle must behave in such a way that there is no danger to other motorists when turning into a property, when turning and when reversing. If necessary, they must let themselves be directed. If the line-of-sight of the person directing is hindered or broken, stop.
2.6.03-001.text: What is the correct response if, when reversing a combination vehicle the view to the rear is impeded?

2.7.02-030.asw_1: I go to a car workshop

2.7.02-030.info: If the vehicle pulls to the side when braking, this indicates technical problems with the brake system. As this impairs safety, a specialist at a car workshop must be consulted.

2.5.01-207.asw_1: - combining several destinations into one single trip
2.5.01-207.asw_2: - forming car pools with other vehicle users
2.5.01-207.asw_3: - planning to use public transport instead of my own vehicle
2.5.01-207.info: By combining several destinations, longer single trips can be avoided. Carpooling also reduces negative environmental impacts. The same applies to the use of public transport.

2.5.01-208.asw_1: - select a gear in which I am not required to brake a great deal

2.5.01-208.info: On slopes, it is possible to use the braking effect of the engine by driving in a correspondingly low gear.

2.5.01-209.asw_1: All two and three-wheeled motor vehicles
2.5.01-209.asw_3: All motor vehicles with a catalytic converter
2.5.01-209.info: All two- and three-wheel motor vehicles are permitted to enter environmental zones despite the lack of a fine-particle badge. The same goes for all agricultural and forestry tractors.
2.5.01-209.text: What motor vehicles are permitted to enter an environment zone without a fine-particle badge?

2.5.01-210.info: Emissions class, fuel consumption and efficiency class allow conclusions to be drawn about the environmental friendliness of a passenger car.

2.5.01-211.asw_2: - the level of material wear is higher
2.5.01-211.asw_3: - the vehicle's battery will be over-charged
2.5.01-211.asw_pretext: Because driving with a cold engine means
2.5.01-211.info: Driving with a cold engine results in higher material wear. In addition, fuel consumption is increased.
2.5.01-211.text: Why are short journeys performed with a cold engine especially damaging to the environment?

2.5.01-212.asw_1: By sounding the horn as a greeting
2.5.01-212.info: Honking as a greeting is avoidable noise, as is the loud slamming of vehicle doors.

2.6.07-220.asw_1: Entering an address in the sat-nav
2.6.07-220.asw_3: Using the telephone even through a hands-free unit

2.1.05-103.info: In forest areas, visibility is often restricted, and crossing wild animals in particular are only recognised at a late stage. Behind hilltops, a broken-down vehicle or a very slow vehicle can suddenly occupy the road. In front of schools, there is always the risk that children will unexpectedly run onto the road.

2.1.05-104-M.asw_3: Because of the low volume of traffic

2.1.06-012-M.info: The vehicle following your vehicle is driving too close. It is advisable to make room for it to overtake. Before that, however, it is necessary to safely complete one's own overtaking manoeuvre, thereby overtaking both the red van and the blue car.

2.1.08-018.asw_1: I have to reduce my speed

2.2.03-305.asw_2: On vehicle roadways not inside a built-up area, with separate carriageways for each direction
2.2.03-305.asw_3: On vehicle roadways not inside a built-up area, with at least two marked lanes for each direction

2.2.05-102-M.asw_1: - overtake at a substantially higher speed
2.2.05-102-M.asw_2: - overtake while maintaining the speed driven
2.2.05-102-M.asw_3: - do not overtake, because a motorbike is in moving in the blind spot

2.7.02-032.asw_pretext: Answer: The minimum tread depth amounts to
2.7.02-032.info: The main tread must have a profile depth of at least 1.6 mm on the entire circumference. The main tread pattern is considered to be the wide tread grooves in the middle of the tread, which occupies about 3/4 of the tread width.
2.7.02-032.text: What is the permissible minimum tread depth of the main tread of all your vehicle's tyres?

2.1.06-013.asw_1: I cease the overtaking manoeuvre and remain behind the truck
2.1.06-013.asw_2: I accelerate and quickly continue the overtaking manoeuvre
2.1.06-013.asw_3: I maintain my speed and continue the overtaking manoeuvre
2.1.06-013.info: In all cases, a lane may only be changed if there is no danger to other motorists. Since a collision with the red car is imminent when pulling out, the overtaking process must be stopped.
2.1.06-013.text: You want to overtake. What is the right course of action now?

2.1.06-014.asw_1: I quickly continue the overtaking manoeuvre
2.1.06-014.asw_2: I cease the overtaking manoeuvre, and pull back into the right-hand lane
2.1.06-014.asw_3: I brake, but continue the overtaking manoeuvre
2.1.06-014.info: It's too late to stop overtaking. Stopping the process of overtaking could lead to a dangerous situation. Therefore, the overtaking process must be completed.

2.1.06-015.asw_1: I overtake the van and then move into the middle lane
2.1.06-015.asw_2: I move immediately into the lane to the right
2.1.06-015.asw_3: I brake slightly to prompt the vehicle behind to keep its distance
2.1.06-015.info: An interruption of the overtaking process, which would result in moving into the lane behind the grey van, could lead to a dangerous situation. Therefore, the overtaking process must be completed.

2.1.08-021.asw_1: I move onto the motorway ahead of the green truck
2.1.08-021.asw_2: I brake and move onto the motorway behind the green truck
2.1.08-021.asw_3: I stop at the end of the merging lane, and move onto the motorway behind the blue truck
2.1.08-021.info: Acceleration on the merging lane is permitted in order to merge onto the motorway at an appropriate speed. It is permitted to overtake the green truck.

2.1.11-126.info: Aggression can have a negative impact on driving behaviour and ultimately on road safety. It should thus be avoided.

2.1.11-127.asw_1: He anticipates the mistakes of other road users
2.1.11-127.asw_3: He is assertive towards other road traffic
2.1.11-127.info: A responsible driver expects mistakes to be made by other motorists. In case of fatigue, he avoids the use of a motor vehicle.
2.1.11-127.text: Which is the stamp of a responsible driver?

2.1.11-128.info: All these feelings, both negative and positive, can influence driving behaviour by, for example, causing distractions or increasing the likelihood of risk-taking behaviours.

2.1.11-129.info: Heavy eyelids, increased yawning and difficulty paying attention are all signs of fatigue.
2.1.11-129.text: What indications mean you should interrupt your journey?

2.2.05-011.asw_1: I cease the overtaking manoeuvre and move into the right-hand lane
2.2.05-011.asw_2: I accelerate and continue the overtaking manoeuvre
2.2.05-011.asw_3: I continue the overtaking manoeuvre at an unchanged speed

2.2.05-012.asw_2: - overtaking manoeuvre of the green truck takes longer to complete
2.2.05-012.info: The speed difference between the two trucks is small. It can thus be assumed that the overtaking process of the green truck will take longer. The blue car has caught up with the white truck. It's possible that this car is pulling out to overtake.

2.2.05-013.info: A path on which a cyclist is approaching crosses the road. Due to the orange truck, the spot is difficult to see and the cyclist is currently out of sight. Therefore, care must be taken when overtaking the truck.

2.2.05-014-M.info: On its own lane, a motorcycle approaches the oncoming traffic, which is overtaking. Due to the short distance, your own speed must be reduced so that the motorcyclist can pull into the lane in time.

2.2.07-005.info: The vehicles of the truck convoy are not driving at the same speed. The yellow truck is reducing its distance to the blue truck. It could swing out and start to overtake.

2.2.07-006.asw_1: I let the blue car merge in front of me

2.2.09-002-M.info: The oncoming car will turn left from its perspective. In this way, the motorist creates space for the motorcyclist, who is behind the automobile and probably wants to continue straight ahead. The motorcyclist must be given the right of way.

2.2.18-215.asw_1: - gives warnings about motorists heading in the wrong direction
2.2.18-215.asw_3: - is a prescribed requirement for travelling on the motorway
2.2.18-215.info: Switching on the traffic information on the radio can warn of motorists driving in the wrong direction. The traffic information can also inform you about traffic jams.

2.2.22-117.asw_1: Loads that project beyond the retro-reflectors by more than 1 m, must be labelled

In addition, in the case of a load of up to 50 cm above the towing vehicle, the load projection may project up to 50 cm beyond the vehicle. If the outermost end of the load projects more than 1 m beyond the rear lights of the vehicle, it should be clearly marked.

2.2.37-007.asw_1: Permanently illuminated signs either block lanes or open them up to traffic

2.2.37-008.asw_2: - 2 must change to the right-side lane
2.2.37-008.info: Symbol 1 (green permanent light sign) permits driving in the lane. Symbol 2 (yellow continuous light signal) prompts you to change to the right.

2.5.01-016.asw_2: The emission of harmful substances increases
2.5.01-016.info: Driving at a high speed results in high fuel consumption. The emission of pollutants also increases. The noise level increases.

2.7.05-217.asw_2: The wheel can become detached from the vehicle

2.1.11-130.info: The driver's attention should always be focused on the driving activity in order to have the vehicle under the best possible control and to be able to follow the traffic situation without restriction.

2.1.11-131.info: As a rule, the distance to a vehicle in front must be such that it can be held even if the driver of the vehicle in front of you brakes suddenly. Any information the passenger provides that contributes to safety must be taken seriously.

2.2.09-003-M.asw_2: - now in order to make the carriageway clear
2.2.09-003-M.asw_3: - now so that following vehicles will not be confused by my slowing down

2.1.06-018-M.info: The overtaking passenger car has underestimated the situation. Since it has almost overtaken completely, your own speed should be reduced. This allows the red car to move in earlier. In addition, it is necessary to drive to the extreme right in order to create additional space.

The aim is to reduce your speed and to keep a safe distance in order to be able to decelerate immediately in an emergency or even initiate an emergency-braking manoeuvre.

2.1.11-009-M.asw_3: I sound my horn and flash my headlights persistently

2.1.10-003.info: Driver assistance systems can raise false expectations, so that motorists overestimate the possibilities of technology. There is a danger that motorists will rely on such systems too greatly and thus will not pay attention to the traffic situation sufficiently. 2.1.11-011.asw_2: - to my destination, so that I can recover my composure
2.1.11-011.info: The situation has caused an inner restlessness or even insecurity, which can impair the driver's abilities. An intermediate stop can help you to calm down and continue your journey safely afterwards.

2.1.11-012.asw_2: I will become tired more quickly

2.7.01-134.info: As a driver of an electric car, it is important to know what possibilities are available on site to charge the vehicle's battery. It is also important to know what the range is and which factors influence it. Drivers of electric cars should know how to behave after an accident.

2.7.01-135.asw_3: The influence of external ambient temperatures on the range
2.7.01-135.info: During longer journeys with a purely electric vehicle, the range of the battery will not be sufficient to reach the destination without interruption. It should also be known how extreme outside temperatures affect the range of the vehicle.

2.7.01-136.asw_2: Charging should only be performed with a charging cable approved by the manufacturer
2.7.01-136.asw_3: Charging is available at every filling station

2.7.01-137.asw_2: - do not have any direct exhaust emissions
2.7.01-137.info: Electric cars are significantly quieter due to their motors. Likewise, no direct pollutants are emitted during driving.

2.7.01-138.asw_2: Cyclist travelling ahead will turn left, without looking behind them
2.7.01-138.asw_3: Vehicles following behind will tailgate me
2.7.01-138.info: Due to the quiet operating noise, electric cars are only noticed later or not at all. The same also applies to cyclists who do not suspect a vehicle behind them as a result and thus turn without prior notice.

2.7.06-110.info: Switching off the cruise control too late can result in too high a speed. There is a danger of driving too close to other motorists. There is a risk of too high a cornering speed. The maximum permissible speed may be exceeded.

2.7.06-111.asw_2: With maintaining an energy-saving driving style
2.7.06-111.asw_3: With maintaining the minimum distance to the vehicle ahead
