2.7.06-112.asw_2: The system can be affected by heavy rain or snow fall
2.7.06-112.asw_3: Activating the accelerator or brake pedal can always override the system
2.7.06-112.info: The use of such a system requires attention from the driver so that he or she can react immediately in an emergency and, for example, increase the distance. Rain or snowfall can impair the technology. As soon as the brake or accelerator pedal is depressed, the pedal takes precedence and overrides the adaptive cruise control system.

2.1.07-120-M.asw_1: - restore the safety distance by braking

2.2.21-121.asw_1: - the child safety locks on the rear doors

2.5.01-119.info: Luggage that is transported inside the vehicle and not on the outside does not increase air drag. Accordingly, it makes sense to transport luggage in the boot. The same applies to storing luggage behind the front seats.

2.2.07-011.info: On roads with several lanes for one direction, if it is not possible to drive continuously on one lane or if one lane ends, the vehicles prevented from continuing should be allowed to pass over to the adjacent lane in such a way that these vehicles can alternate with a vehicle travelling on the continuous lane immediately before the narrowing begins (zipper feed-in method).

2.2.15-114.asw_1: A malfunctioning car with assisted steering is difficult to steer
2.2.15-114.asw_2: When towing an electric vehicle, it is necessary to following the manufacturer’s guidelines
2.2.15-114.asw_3: Driving licence class BE is the minimum required in order to tow a car
2.2.15-114.info:
If the motor fails, the brake booster is not available. In order to achieve a comparable braking force, applying a higher pedal pressure is necessary. Towing by means of a tow bar creates a connection that acts between the vehicles in both directions and thus provides some support during braking.

If an electric vehicle is towed, the manufacturer's instructions must be observed.
2.2.15-114.text: Your car has an engine fault and must be towed away with a tow rope. What must you be aware of?

2.2.17-012.info: The headlights must be switched on.Driving with the parking light alone is not allowed. The illumination of the road is insufficient and at the same time there is a risk of being recognized late by oncoming traffic.The high beam may only be switched on on roads which do not have a continuous, sufficient illumination. In case of oncoming traffic, the high beam must always be switched off immediately.
2.2.17-012.text: As a basic rule, what lights of a motor vehicle must be turned on when driving in darkness?

2.2.21-123.asw_1: The infant carrier must be positioned reversed to the direction of travel

2.2.21-123.info: All three answers are correct.In passenger seats where an operational airbag is installed in front, rearward-facing baby restraints must not be installed, i.e. the passenger airbag must be deactivated.Of course, the baby must be strapped in the baby carrier.

2.2.22-127.info: All three answers are correct.Luggage net, tension belt and anti-slip mat are suitable for securing loads.

2.2.22-128.asw_2: - place heavy luggage at the bottom
2.2.22-128.info: All three answers are correct.The warning triangle must be ready to hand at all times.In order to avoid endangering the occupants, e.g. in the event of a hazard braking maneuver, luggage should be secured against slipping and heavy luggage should be stowed as far down as possible.
2.2.22-128.text: What should you remember when loading luggage into a car luggage compartment?

2.2.23-122.asw_1: - the telephone in not held in my hand for this purpose

2.2.23-122.info: Anyone driving a vehicle may not use a mobile or car telephone if the mobile telephone or the handset of the car telephone must be picked up or held for this purpose. This does not apply if the vehicle is stationary and the engine is switched off in the case of motor vehicles. Operation of the device may create a distraction that could endanger road safety.

2.5.01-012.asw_3: Motor vehicles that meet the requirements for a green particulate emissions sticker, even if no such sticker is attached
2.5.01-012.info: Motorcycles do not need an environmental sticker. Only four-wheeled vehicles need a sticker and are allowed to enter the environmental zone with a green particulate matter sticker.

2.5.01-121.info: All three answers are correct.All measures that reduce pollutant emissions contribute to environmentally friendly driving.

2.5.01-122.asw_2: Use the eco mode when driving
2.5.01-122.asw_3: Switch off the engine when driving down a gradient
2.5.01-122.info:
During "kick down", the engine shifts down and accelerates at maximum speed, which increases fuel consumption enormously. Therefore, avoiding "kick downs" is considered fuel-efficient.

If the engine of a car with automatic transmission is switched off while driving, transmission damage may occur.
2.5.01-122.text: How can you save fuel if you drive a car with an automatic gearbox?

2.6.03-114.asw_1: - towable weight of the towing vehicle

2.6.07-101.asw_2: - labelling requirements for driving in environment zones

2.6.07-101.info: All three answers are correct.Speed restrictions, environmental zones and city tolls are regulated very differently abroad. A violation can lead to sometimes drastic fines.
2.6.07-101.text: What must you be aware of when route planning abroad?

2.7.01-065.asw_1: Wearing a suitable crash helmet is mandatory
2.7.01-065.asw_2: Quads are prone to tipping over when driving through tight bends
2.7.01-065.asw_3: The handling characteristics are similar to those of a car
2.7.01-065.info: The driving characteristics of a quad bike do not correspond to those of a car in many areas.Since one cannot "lay" oneself with Quads, contrary to the motorcycle, into the curve, there is the danger of "tilting" outward by centrifugal force.Wearing a protective helmet is mandatory.STVO §21a, 2:Anyone who drives motorcycles or open three- or multi-wheeled motor vehicles with a maximum design speed of over 20 km/h as well as riding on or in them must wear a suitable safety helmet while driving.This does not apply if mandatory safety belts are worn.

2.7.01-066.asw_1: Protective motorcycle clothing should be worn
2.7.01-066.asw_2: A warning triangle must be carried on the quad
2.7.01-066.asw_3: The necessary steering force can be significantly greater than with a car
2.7.01-066.info: All three answers are correct.A first aid kit (§ 35h StVZO) and a warning triangle (§ 53a StVZO) must be carried.Since there is usually no power steering, the steering forces can be much higher than in a car.
2.7.01-066.text: What should be observed when driving a quad?

2.7.04-101.info: Depending on the vehicle, the engine oil level can be checked at the driver information system or the Oil Dipstick.

Rain or snowfall can impair the technology. As soon as the brake or accelerator pedal is depressed, the pedal takes precedence and overrides the adaptive cruise control system.

2.1.03-120.info: Avenues are often narrow, which can lead to conflicts with oncoming traffic. Due to the narrow tree planting unevenness of the road surface may occur, which can be due to the roots of the trees. In principle, you may only drive so fast that it is possible to stop within sight at any time. However, in lanes that are so narrow that oncoming vehicles could be endangered, motorists must drive so slowly that at least half of the visible distance can be maintained.

Honk only who overtakes outside built-up areas or who sees himself or others endangered.

2.2.18-104-M.info: Lane Change Assist (also: Blind Spot Assist) warns drivers of impending collisions when changing lanes. Here it warns of the vehicle in the middle lane. It does not change lanes on its own and does not brake automatically if the distance to the vehicle in front becomes too small.

Drags that occure while driving increase exponentially and not linearly with the increasing speed. Additional 30 km/h instead of 130 km/h can thus increase fuel consumption by up to 35 percent.

The weight and tread depth do not affect the fuel consumption of a vehicle as much.

2.7.02-038.asw_3: The main beam light switch is faulty

2.7.02-129.asw_3: - only use the handbrake from that time on

Your car must be checked at the workshop immediately.To avoid any risk, you must therefore continue to drive at a low speed.In many modern vehicles, the "hand brake" is a "parking brake" and blocks the rear wheels. 2.2.15-115.info:
Because the vehicle remains on the road, it poses a danger to other motorists. Other motorists must be warned of the danger by flashing a warning light. There is an obligation to put up a warning sign at a sufficient distance to warn the approaching traffic of the danger at an early stage. Standard values are:

  • inner city: 50 meters
  • country road: 100 meters
  • Freeway: 150 to 400 meters

Wearing a high-visibility vest is a safety measure that helps to improve visibility for other motorists.

On winding roads, the distance to the traffic ahead is more difficult to detect, so AGR is not so suitable here.

StVO § 5 Overtaking

(2) Overtaking is only permitted to anyone who can see that there is no obstruction to oncoming traffic during the entire overtaking process.

2.5.01-127.info: An electric motor has hardly any waste heat, so the heating power is drawn directly from the battery. The power consumption for this is by no means negligible and has a corresponding negative impact on the range.When braking, recuperation turns the electric motor into a generator. Part of the kinetic energy is converted back into electricity, thus charging the battery.Short, strong acceleration requires a lot of energy and thus shortens the range.

The speed is automatically regulated, i.e., the vehicle accelerates until the set speed is reached. When approaching a vehicle in front at a lower speed, the system adjusts its own speed accordingly.

The safety distance required in each case depends on various factors and cannot be detected or known by the system.

2.2.14-108-M.asw_1: - by looking in my left-hand exterior rear-view mirror before opening the door
2.2.14-108-M.asw_2: - by glancing over my left shoulder before opening the door
2.2.14-108-M.asw_3: - just by looking through the slightly opened door
2.2.14-108-M.asw_pretext: I observe the traffic approaching from the rear
2.2.14-108-M.info: Anyone getting on or off the vehicle must behave in such a way that there is no risk to other road users.This requires looking over the shoulder and observing the traffic in the left-hand side mirror.
2.2.14-108-M.text: You have stopped in a parking strip and now want to exit your vehicle. What must you do in this situation?

2.2.34-102.asw_1: - makes it easier to document the accident with foreign-speaking parties involved in the accident
2.2.34-102.asw_2: - enables the parties involved to independently document the accident
2.2.34-102.asw_3: - unambiguously clarifies the issue of liability at the scene of the accident
2.2.34-102.asw_pretext: Because, in the event of an accident, the European accident report form
2.2.34-102.info: The European accident report is a standardized form used throughout Europe to document the course of an accident.It facilitates and enables the recording of the accident, especially when different languages are spoken.Each party involved in the accident fills out an accident report and each party receives a copy of the completed report.The information provided is not an admission of guilt, and the question of liability is not clarified by the accident report.
2.2.34-102.text: Why should you always carry the European accident report form with you on your journey?

2.2.38-101.asw_1: I drive over to the right-side as far as possible
2.2.38-101.info: Blue flashing light together with the emergency horn orders: "All other road users must clear the way immediately".Since there is no oncoming traffic in sight, drive as far to the right as possible and reduce speed sufficiently in this situation.Stopping is not necessary.
2.2.38-101.text: A vehicle with flashing blue lights and siren sounding is approaching you from the rear. What is the right course of action now?

2.5.01-128.asw_3: - means that energy can be recovered from the braking operation
2.5.01-128.info: Recuperation refers to a technical process for recovering energy.In electric vehicles, the electric motor becomes a generator as soon as the foot is taken off the gas pedal while driving.  Electrical energy is recovered and fed back into the battery.Depending on the recuperation strength set, braking is stepped up and more electricity is generated.The service brake system is spared because it is used less often.
2.5.01-128.text: What is the benefit of recuperation in an electric vehicle?

2.7.01-160.text: Which driver assistance systems do you have to manually activate to assist you in specific situations?

2.7.05-005.asw_1: There will be a considerable deterioration in the vehicle’s manoeuvrability
2.7.05-005.asw_2: The vehicle’s stability will be dangerously reduced when cornering
2.7.05-005.asw_3: The level of tyre wear will decrease greatly
2.7.05-005.info: If the tire pressure is significantly too low, the tire loses its stability. This worsens driving stability and steering behavior.Tire wear increases sharply and does not decrease.
2.7.05-005.text: Your tyre inflation pressure is clearly too low while you driving on public roads. What is the consequence of this?
